CONJUGATES: heading (singular noun) | headings (plural noun) | head (base verb) | heading (present participle/gerund) | headed (past tense/past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English heding, from the verb 'to head' (Old English hēafodian) + suffix '-ing'. Noun meanings developed from the gerund form, referring to something that is at the 'head' or 'front' (like a title) or the action of moving in a certain 'head' direction.
SINCE: Late 14th century (as a gerund); late 16th century (as a noun for a title)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or group of words placed at the top of a document or passage, used as a title or to introduce a section.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A title or caption at the top of a page or section of a book, article, or document.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 文件、书籍、文章或章节顶部用作标题或介绍部分的文字或短语。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The report had a clear heading for each section.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这份报告的每个部分都有清晰的标题。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or group of words placed at the top of a document or passage, used as a title or to introduce a section.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The direction in which someone or something is moving or oriented.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某人或某物移动或面向的方向。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ship altered its heading to avoid the storm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这艘船改变了航向以避开风暴。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Describes an ongoing action or forms a noun representing an action; derived from the verb 'to head'.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The act of moving in a specified direction.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 朝着特定方向移动的行为。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We are heading towards a new era of technology.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们正在走向一个科技新时代。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Describes an ongoing action or forms a noun representing an action; derived from the verb 'to head'.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The act of hitting a ball with one's head in sports, especially soccer.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在体育运动中，尤指足球中，用头击球的行为。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His powerful heading led to the winning goal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他强有力的头球导致了制胜一球。

REGISTER: formal to informal, depending on context
